title: Courteney Cox posts 'rare' pic with 'Friends' co-stars, Matt LeBlanc and Jennifer Aniston!
text:
It's been 15 years since the show went off the air, but "Friends" fans still love it when the stars from the show reunite.

Proving that the friendship has endured since the iconic show ended in 2004, Courteney Cox shared a post on Instagram this weekend which included a picture of her with her former co-stars Matt LeBlanc and Jennifer Aniston.

"A rare night and I love it," write Cox in the post's caption.

Fans also loved it. The post has 2.1 million likes. "I’m crying," one fan commented.

Cox is the big social media maven among the former castmates, sharing often on Instagram.

In May, she shared a picture from before the show began.

"The one where the six of us went to Vegas and no one knew we were F.R.I.E.N.D.S yet #tbt #beforeitaired #lovetheseguys," she captioned the group shot, featuring herself with Aniston, David Schwimmer, LeBlanc, Lisa Kudrow and Matthew Perry.

And the show recently had a major milestone with its 25th anniversary, so she posted last month, "Celebrating a Thursday night 25 years ago. Thank you to all of our loyal fans across the world. You’ve certainly been there for us! I love these guys!"

Best 'Friends' for life it seems and fans couldn't be happier.
